headline: Apollo buys majority stake in Stream Data Centers
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -Apollo agreed to buy a majority interest in Stream Data Centers (SDC), the alternative asset manager said on Wednesday, in a bet on rising demand for digital infrastructure fueled by artificial intelligence and cloud computing.  Investors are lining up to put money into data centers, as demand for computing power soars.  SDC builds, leases, manages and operates huge campuses and has delivered more than 20 to date, Apollo said in a statement.

raw.headline: Apollo buys majority stake in Stream Data Centers
raw.summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -Apollo agreed to buy a majority interest in Stream Data Centers (SDC), the alternative asset manager said on Wednesday, in a bet on rising demand for digital infrastructure fueled by artificial intelligence and cloud computing.  Investors are lining up to put money into data centers, as demand for computing power soars.  SDC builds, leases, manages and operates huge campuses and has delivered more than 20 to date, Apollo said in a statement.

headline: CDW tops quarterly estimates on steady demand from healthcare, government customers
summary: CDW beat Wall Street estimates for second-quarter results on Wednesday, helped by continued demand for IT solutions from its healthcare and government customers. The increasing need for hybrid data centers by combining cloud and on-premise infrastructure, has created new growth opportunities for CDW. CDW provides information technology solutions such as security, cloud, hybrid infrastructure to business, government, education and healthcare customers in the United States, the United Kingdom and Canada.

headline: AI accounting startup Rillet raises $70 million in Andreessen Horowitz, ICONIQ-led round
summary: (Reuters) -Rillet, a startup developing AI-powered accounting software, has raised $70 million in a fundraise co-led by venture capital firms Andreessen Horowitz and ICONIQ in a bid to disrupt an industry dominated by tools from Oracle and Microsoft.  The company did not disclose the valuation it secured in the Series B funding round.  A source close to the deal said the startup was valued at around $500 million.

headline: AI Weekly: mega-soft and soccer droids
summary: STORY: From why Microsoft is more like mega-soft, to why Chinese droids are playing soccer, this is AI Weekly.Microsoft hit $4 trillion in market value on signs that AI is starting to pay off.The tech giant said sales were soaring at its Azure cloud computing unit, thanks to the new tech.It claimed over 100 million users for its Copilot AI tools.OpenAI is considering a share sale that would value it at $500 billion.That’s according to a Reuters source.The share sale would offer financial incentives to OpenAI workers amid a fierce battle for AI-related talent.Droids in China are gearing up for the inaugural World Humanoid Robot Games with some soccer skills.This Tsinghua University researcher says his team’s bot is using imitation learning - that’s where it watches humans, and then learns to emulate them through constant repetition.Now the upcoming games are meant to spur real-world applications for humanoid robots, turning soccer into a testbed for innovation.McDonald’s is betting on AI to boost profits.The burger chain is already using the tech at some branches to verify orders and spot errors before handing them over to customers.It also wants to ramp up use of the tech to forecast sales and decide on pricing.And Apple is promising to do better on AI.Chief Executive Tim Cook has signaled the iPhone maker will spend more to catch rivals.Apple has been widely criticized by investors for being slow to roll out services using the new tech.Among the problems, it’s delayed launching an AI-powered version of its Siri voice assistant.

raw.headline: AI Weekly: mega-soft and soccer droids
raw.summary: STORY: From why Microsoft is more like mega-soft, to why Chinese droids are playing soccer, this is AI Weekly.Microsoft hit $4 trillion in market value on signs that AI is starting to pay off.The tech giant said sales were soaring at its Azure cloud computing unit, thanks to the new tech.It claimed over 100 million users for its Copilot AI tools.OpenAI is considering a share sale that would value it at $500 billion.That’s according to a Reuters source.The share sale would offer financial incentives to OpenAI workers amid a fierce battle for AI-related talent.Droids in China are gearing up for the inaugural World Humanoid Robot Games with some soccer skills.This Tsinghua University researcher says his team’s bot is using imitation learning - that’s where it watches humans, and then learns to emulate them through constant repetition.Now the upcoming games are meant to spur real-world applications for humanoid robots, turning soccer into a testbed for innovation.McDonald’s is betting on AI to boost profits.The burger chain is already using the tech at some branches to verify orders and spot errors before handing them over to customers.It also wants to ramp up use of the tech to forecast sales and decide on pricing.And Apple is promising to do better on AI.Chief Executive Tim Cook has signaled the iPhone maker will spend more to catch rivals.Apple has been widely criticized by investors for being slow to roll out services using the new tech.Among the problems, it’s delayed launching an AI-powered version of its Siri voice assistant.

headline: Commonwealth Fusion Systems Names Christopher P. Liddell to Board of Directors
summary: Commonwealth Fusion Systems (CFS), the largest private fusion company, today announced that Christopher P. headline: Microsoft Highlights Gieni AI as Vertical AI Reference at Build 2025
summary: Photo Courtesy of: Orderfox ZURICH, Aug. 05, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Orderfox Schweiz AG announced that its market intelligence platform, Gieni AI, was featured as a reference case for vertical AI integration at Microsoft Build 2025. The platform was selected to demonstrate Microsoft’s new Model Context Protocol (MCP), which allows AI agents to access and interact with other agents and software tools in real time.
